contentrichtext.text: '''Yacin Yabeh Galeb''' was the chief of staff of Force Nationale de Police of [[Djibouti]] from 1977 to December 7, 2000 when he was demoted to adviser to interior minister. Shortly afterwards police loyal to him attempted a [[coup d'état]]. The coup attempt was stopped by the army;<ref name=Witness>[http://www.irinnews.org/Report.aspx?ReportId=949 "Witnesses describe “coup attempt”"], IRIN, December 8, 2000.</ref><ref name=Arrested>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/1061189.stm "Djibouti rebel police officers arrested"], BBC News, December 8, 2000.</ref> he fled to a French military base but was turned over to Djibouti authorities on December 9.<ref>[http://www.irinnews.org/Report.aspx?ReportId=926 "French hand over ‘coup’ leader"], IRIN, December 11, 2000.</ref> On December 13 he was charged in court with conspiracy and breaching state security.<ref>[http://www.irinnews.org/Report.aspx?ReportId=820 "Coup attempt leader charged"], IRIN, December 14, 2000.</ref> He was said to be an old friend of President [[Ismail Omar Guelleh]],<ref name=Witness/><ref name=Arrested/> but relations between the two had reportedly been worsening prior to the events.<ref name=Arrested/> Yacin Yabeh Galeb was reportedly released for medical treatment in June 2001,<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/1378399.stm "Djibouti coup plotter released"], BBC News, June 8, 2001.</ref> but he was sentenced to 15 years in prison in June 2002.<ref>[http://www.irinnews.org/Report.aspx?ReportId=32546 "15-year jail term for former police chief"], IRIN, June 18, 2002.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Galeb, Yacin Yabeh | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Djiboutian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Galeb, Yacin Yabeh}} [[Category:Djiboutian prisoners and detainees]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Police officers]] [[Category:Government ministers of Djibouti]]
